headline: Expression strongly regulated by nutrient availability, stress conditions, and developmental stage
one_paragraph_summary:
This gene exhibits dramatic expression changes in response to multiple environmental and developmental cues in Aspergillus fumigatus. Key patterns include:
  • Nutrient-dependent regulation - severely downregulated under zinc/nitrate limitation (77-fold) and iron starvation (14-fold)
  • Developmental specificity - highly expressed in dormant conidia but strongly repressed during germination and hyphal growth
  • Stress responsiveness - upregulated by hypoxia (3-7 fold) and hydrogen peroxide, but downregulated by antifungal treatments
  • Antisense transcription - consistently high antisense expression across conditions suggests complex transcriptional regulation
The coordinated responses to metal availability, oxidative stress, and developmental transitions suggest this gene may function in stress-responsive metabolic regulation or cellular homeostasis pathways.

topics.headline: Transcription factor-mediated regulation under nutrient limitation
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene is dramatically downregulated in ACE1 deletion mutants under zinc/nitrate limitation and shows elevated expression in atfA deletion mutants in conidia, indicating regulation by multiple transcription factors.

topics.headline: Opposing responses to oxidative stress and iron availability
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene is upregulated by hydrogen peroxide treatment but severely downregulated by iron starvation, with iron limitation overriding oxidative stress induction in combined treatments.

topics.headline: Hypoxic adaptation and progressive upregulation under oxygen limitation
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene shows consistent progressive upregulation during hypoxic conditions across multiple experiments, increasing 3-7 fold over time periods ranging from hours to days.

topics.headline: Antifungal drug responses and strain-dependent effects
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene exhibits differential responses to antifungal treatments including itraconazole and caspofungin, with responses varying significantly between wild-type and mutant strains.

topics.headline: Host-pathogen interaction and cell wall stress responses
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene is downregulated during co-culture with human epithelial cells and shows dramatic repression in response to Congo Red treatment across multiple transcription factor mutants.

topics.headline: Growth medium-dependent antisense transcription patterns
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene displays striking antisense transcript expression that varies dramatically between different growth media, with minimal sense transcript expression across conditions.
